page.title: 02BERWICK ESTATE.
page.content: Berwick is a private estate of 2,000 acres lying 1 mile to the north of Shrewsbury. The house itself is within our D-Block. There are 9 farms including the Home Farm and 1 small-holding on the estate. The house, originally built in 1731, was restored in 1877. The house is of red brick with typical Georgian windows. It is 3 storeys high. There are many large rooms with fine oak carvings. There are dining rooms, a library, kitchen, billiards room and many bedrooms. Gardens and farmland surround the house. The Home Farm, next to the house is renowned for its fine herd of Jersey cattle. The chapel is still used for Sunday services. Former employees live in the Almshouses.
